  • Method Details

    • updateEntity

      public static <T> T updateEntity(T entity, Map<String,Object> fields, List<String> nonNegativeFields)
      Updates the specified entity object with the given fields. This method allows you to update a T generic type object with the supplied fields. Fields are represented as Map<String, Object>, where the key is the field name. to be updated and the value is the new value for that field. Additionally, this method provides the ability to specify a list of non-negative fields. If the updated value of a field is of type float and is present in the non-negative fields list, the method will check if the new value is non-negative. Note: The fields "id" and "city" are excluded from being updated.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the entity to be updated.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity object to be updated.
      fields - A map containing the field names as keys and their new values as values.
      nonNegativeFields - A list of field names that should have non-negative values if of type float.
      Returns:
      The updated entity object.
      Throws:
      BadRequestBodyException - If the updated float value of a field in nonNegativeFields is negative.
      BadRequestBodyException - If the value of a field is not a number or not compatible with float type.
